review_title: Life at a fast-pace hyper-growth tech unicorn!
pros: Samsara is a tech unicorn and is currently massively growing. The environment is super fast pace and at the end of the day, I am amazed at how fast the day has gone by. People are extremely talented and bright. You choose how to involve you want to be in the culture with the vast amount of clubs and opportunities to network with other employees.
cons: The company is constantly hiring so it takes away from daily productivity. However, time management is key to being successful here
advice_to_mgmt: Keep doing what you are doing! The growth is amazing, I am excited to see how the Samsara culture evolves as we continue to grow in every department.

pros:
Growing fast
Good work life balance
Great CEO
Friendly and eager to help management
Fun employees
Young company
Responsive to customers
Great career pathway
cons: Very few qualms. Work culture is a bit male-centric due to our customer base but other than that it's a healthy culture.

pros: Room for growth within the company
cons: It’s your typical sales job.

review_title: Be realistic, no job will be perfect.
pros: It's so clear that some of the recent reviews were written by people in their first job who may not realize work is not going to be fun 100% of the time or just don't like their position. Samsara is my third full time job out of college and it blows the other two companies out of the water. The entire company cares about your success and is willing to invest in your professional growth. You can change teams if you don't like your position. Some of the negative reviews around sales seem to focus on just not liking sales itself. At any company, sales will be grindy and you'll feel underpaid if you aren't hitting quota. Luckily, Samsara allows you to switch career paths within the company after just six months, so anyone who doesn't like sales can try a new path. Samsara has free lunch and tons of company activities and I really don't think there's much to complain about. Benefits are also completely above average (especially for a startup) and there's an extremely high caliber of talent and extremely intelligent people from the CEO down. Culture is great as well, everyone is friends and there's literally a slack channel to get automatically matched with a person you've never met so you can grab coffee. Plus, there's tons of clubs you can join if you want to be friends with your coworkers. Like any job or group, the culture is what you make of it and you can either take advantage of the perks or not.
cons: I genuinely can't think of any. Any complaints (even about small things like the catering) seem to get addressed very quickly by the company.
advice_to_mgmt: Make sure culture scales as you grow and be certain new hires are a personality fit for the company. Make sure your managers are fully trained even if they're young and maybe invest in a leadership program to be certain of this. Keep up the great work like constantly adding new benefits and improving our food vendors!

pros: Amazing company to work for. Whip-smart, experienced leadership team that's down to earth + approachable. Super motivated colleagues excited to learn, challenge one another and collaborate. Product is complex, interesting and making a difference for an industry tech often overlooks. You have the opportunity to add real value starting on day one. Great benefits seal the deal.
cons: Growing very quickly so typical company growing pains.

pros:
- Amazing leadership
- Great career growth
- Fun people to work with (I love coming to work everyday)
- Challenging work
- Company is doing really well
cons: We're still a growing company, so there are obviously going to be some growing pains, but they pros far outweigh the cons. It's hard for me to think of cons that are serious.
advice_to_mgmt: Listen to your direct reports to hear if they have any suggestions.

pros:
- Career Growth (I have been promoted twice in under a year)
- Transparent leaders that listen and act upon feedback
- Great benefits and always adding more (i.e. career growth fund, catered lunches, fertility benefits, unlimited PTO...)
- Equity!!
cons:
- Pay tends to be below market
- It's a grind
- no set processes, sometimes it is kind of crazy but thats part of the startup life!
advice_to_mgmt: Keep listening to feedback

pros:
- Product is well developed and much better than the competition
- benefits are good
- CEO is thoughtful and well-intentioned
- strong investment in the company and board members
- Experiencing crazy growth
- relatively achievable quotas
cons:
- It's a call center for lack of a better term.
- your sales activity is micro-managed by managers
- managers are sticklers about arriving on time (by the second) so that they can get you promoted and then leave early and go play golf with each other
- not great coaching or sales development in terms of training
- no team-building events despite the companies massive success
- it's a bro culture to the fullest and no diversity
- OTE is way below market - they sell you on over attainment and raise quotas every single quarter
- people can be subjectively PIPed. A rep on my team had never missed quota, but because his pipeline generation wasn't to their liking they PIPed him
advice_to_mgmt: Treat your sales employees like human beings. Lead trainings, be more active in leading from the front. Not inspiring sales leadership

pros:
Fun atmosphere
Young, energized workforce
Huge market and grown potential
Mostly responds well to customer and employee feedback
cons:
Lack of diversity
Pay is a little below market rate
advice_to_mgmt: Keep aiming to actively improve diversity issues

review_title: It could be for you but it's definitely not for everyone
pros:
Inspirational CEO
Good Benefits
Stock Options- the company has had a meteoric rise and seems destined to continue to do so
Superior product & a gifted engineering dept.
Free lunches
$200 a month Uber/Lyft credits
Fast tracked career due to success
cons:
Culture:
Sink or swim. Great if you're doing well and really miserable if you aren't. At times it felt like a scene from the Wolf of Wall Street. It's a highly pressurized grind culture, very bro-y with limited diversity. There is an expectation that you are at your desk at all times.

Day to day:
Pipe is 80%+ self sourced. You'll need to cold call a few hours a day every day. Quoting, getting discount approvals and generating proposals could be much more efficient.

Financing- I believe this has been covered in another review but this is the most frustrating part of the Samsara sales cycle. A 3rd party financing company is required to give monthly payment options (an industry standard in transportation) to customers. A large % of customers are not approved and you are left in a situation where someone wants to purchase and you literally can't sell the product to them. This may be a teething problem as Samsara grows but it is a huge source of frustration especially as targets grow.

Business Systems/Processes:
Often try to build in-house systems and bolt them onto the CRM which leads to things inevitably breaking. Fixes for these bugs can take weeks and even months, probably a teething problem but very frustrating. It's hard to know if this is a cost saving thing but the cost to productivity should justify investment in some better systems.

Work/life balance- This is not something that is fostered. It's a regular occurrence that reps receive calls from management and directors whilst on PTO. Expect calls in the evenings and on the weekend from your customers and prospects.

Other-
Without going into specifics communication was poor. ADR's take a paycut to progress to AE which I've never heard of before. Pay discrepancies between people doing the same role were common. Targets seemed to be plucked from the air, increasing by 230% when I was there with no additional resources and smaller patches.

In summary, Samsara isn't for everyone, but it may be for you. Don't expect to be developed as a rep but if you can grind it out there is real earning potential. For me the juice wasn't worth the squeeze. There are companies that are better to work for who pay more in the Bay Area. If you get a funny feeling when interviewing that this might not be the place for you you are probably right. If you love the grind, high pressured fast pace environments and enjoy cold calling you'll love it.
advice_to_mgmt:
Acknowledge and act on growing pains.
Be more transparent.
Invest in the staff.

review_title: Not a lot of growth opportunities
pros: Great benefits, humble executives who know what they’re doing, mostly friendly people, extremely fast growth.
cons: Seems they don’t like to hire internally for positions. Hard to move up and hard to switch teams. Some of the management have high egos and belittle people below them. Will work well for you if you’re careful about what you say and know how to climb the corporate latter/ deal with corporate bs. This may mean knocking people out of your way to get there.
advice_to_mgmt: People like Samsara for the startup grind and culture, no need to become so corporate. We get that they are growing fast, but they should remember the people that helped them get there. Samsara will continue to grow but may lose some quality talent if they don’t start investing in employee’s growth.

review_title: Don't recommend, as the culture is miserable- think twice before accepting a position here.
pros:
-Solid benefits
-Good learning experience by doing
-Resourses to do what you need
cons:
-Management is clueless about culture - a surprise given they're repeat founders. It's high burnout, and it's beginning to be a revolving door of talented people.
-Pay is average at best
-No room for upward mobility
advice_to_mgmt: Take a close look at what you're doing and who's managing teams. You're wasting a lot of talent and your reputation is getting around town.

pros: Fast growing company with tons of opportunities and overachievement; great leadership - really cares about employees and work/life balance
cons: Unsexy industry for tech (fleet) but otherwise really none
advice_to_mgmt: Keep being awesome

pros:
- transparent execs
- thoughtful about work culture and diversity
- amazing technology
- challenging problems
- highly value employees
- awesome work/life balance
- organized in all aspects
- fast growing company still focused on cohesiveness
cons:
- lots of interviews to support the company growth (although they're dedicated interview days)
- need to be proactive, self-starter
advice_to_mgmt: Keep on keepin' on!

pros:
Unreal growth trajectory
Best product in (very saturated) market
Out of pros
cons:
1. You're underpaid by market standards. You'll need to avg 200% to make market
2. Your daily activities and tasks are micromanaged
3. The buying persona is typically unprofessional
4. The product itself (while ahead of the competition) is not a core part of the business and will never be treated as a crucial business decision (forecasting impossible)

Okay now why I left...
1. Culture. Culture. Culture.
2. You're not invested in as a professional.
3. The overall growth attracts high sales talent but then you step into what seems like an entry level sales role.
4. Boys club. You're in the club or you're not. If you're not sure, you're not in.
5. Many aspects of sale in this vertical are beyond reps control (financing, financing, financing) - but you don't hit once and you're put on plan. Has nothing to do with rep competence or effort.
6. For the sake of credibility - I never missed quota. My avg attainment was over 300% and I chose to leave and haven't regretted it for a minute.

My advice to those considering. If you have a weird sense, like you're not quite sure if its a good fit.. go with your gut.
Writing this review because I accepted a job here relying on credibility of 5.0 star Glassdoor review rather than my gut. You're welcome.
advice_to_mgmt: I (and others) have attempted to advise middle management on cultural issues and it fell on deaf ears. Was received with borderline threatening rhetoric. Weird.

pros: People are great throughout the company - smart, hard working, helpful. The company is on an incredible trajectory with no signs of slowing down. Love the office location. I come to work every day excited.
cons: You may change desks often. With many experimental teams and roles, it's hard to keep track of everything going on in the business. This is the nature of a company in hyper-growth, so make sure that you are comfortable with change.
advice_to_mgmt: Keep hiring well! You all have done a great job so far. Excited for the future of this company.

pros: Great company to work for.
cons: Nothing I can think about
advice_to_mgmt: Keep up the good work. You are awesome.

pros: Good food, work is interesting
cons: Some managers especially on the Growth, Product/ Marketing side have bloated egos and treat others like they don't matter. Some first time managers/directors have no people experience and are extremely arrogant & insecure. They also got promoted randomly. Execs promote folks who came with them from Meraki or people who joined the company very early. When you ask for promotion, they give you very random feedback and often tell you - you can go work somewhere else. Extremely frustrating and demotivating for people who really care and want to develop their career. There is also extreme lack of transparency and a lot of favoritism can be seen.
advice_to_mgmt: Create a more transparent & inclusive culture

review_title: Selling The Best Solution on the Market
pros:
- As the title says, Samsara truly is the best solution for customers in the space.
- Leadership is second to none.
- Company is growing rapidly with no sign of slowing down.
cons: - Not much transparency as to when you would be promoted or what you have to do (specifically) to get there.
advice_to_mgmt: - Set specific criteria and timeline for promotions.

pros:
- Experienced Leadership Team
- Truly value great talent
- Culture is a top initiative coming from the CEO
- Hard working/ super smart teams
- People move fast
- Culture of Over Achieving
-Best CEO ive ever worked for
cons: - If you aren't comfortable moving fast or being ok with ambiguity, this probably isn't the right place for you

review_title: Awesome company, hard to be promoted
pros:
- Company is growing fast
- Team is friendly and close to each other
- No politic on the Engineering side
- Encouraged to take initiative and work independently
cons:
- other than a couple people who got there early, it's hard to know when and how you'd get to the next level. More importantly if you have experience (most of the team is fresh grads and don't seem to care much about career growth)
- sometimes too independent, creating challenges when things need more people's input.
advice_to_mgmt:
- Work on the career path you’ve been promising
- Work more on decision making process

pros:
Very fast growing company
Lots of opportunity for career growth
Great leadership
cons: Typical growing pains with a startup - ambiguity
advice_to_mgmt: Keep up what you are doing, keep hiring top talent, keep making this an amazing place to work

review_title: Moving at light speed, high expectations, high rewards!
pros:
A truly once-in-a-lifetime opportunity to contribute to an incredibly special company, set of technologies (IoT + Big Data + Cloud), and growth story at almost the ground floor. Love the opportunity to surround myself with crazy intelligent people, and grow my skillset, career, contributions and life experiences at hyper-growth speed.

Executive leadership shows humility, respect and care for every employee (CEO called me by name Week 1). Refreshing lack of politics or red tape, every employee is encouraged to contribute 100% from Day 1. The company is focused on innovation, solving problems and exponential growth, there is no time for egos or hierarchies.

Love that the company provides equity to every employee, so all can share in the benefits of growth. Consequently, all employees act as owners, with the best interests of their colleagues, customers and company at heart, fully committed and aligned on priorities.

Pay is competitive, every offer includes equity, benefits are top notch (better than my last company 5x the size), love the free lunches/dinners/snacks/drinks round the clock, and the special events planned to celebrate wins and drive unity - Sales Kick-Offs, End of Quarter Celebrations, Camp Samsara (who brings an entire company camping?!?), Family Picnics, Happy Hours, Team Outings, etc. Their actions show employees come first.

Love being part of the Customer Support team that genuinely cares about our customers, hires the best and brightest, invests in direct hires (NO outsourcing!) and is laser focused on doing whatever it takes to blow our customers away.
cons: With the speed of growth and change, don't get too comfortable. To thrive here you need to be pragmatic, a self-starter, flexible, focused, competitive and play to win.
advice_to_mgmt: Keep the special culture intact during the hyper-growth phase, continue to listen to your employees, encourage and model sustainable growth (work/life balance), be approachable, and celebrate the wins.

pros:
- Great product
- Inclusive Culture
- Great benefits
- Modern stack (typescript/react, Go)
- Work on hardware, firmware, fe/be
- Actually fast paced in a good way
- mentor is great
- Surprisingly stellar onboarding

Only been here a week but it seems like I definitely made the right choice. The company actively tries to take care of all of your needs, and the product is extremely interesting to build.
cons: Maybe not everyone knows about Samsara...yet
advice_to_mgmt: None. I see everyone really trying to expand into new product markets and it’s very exciting.

pros:
Modern Stack
Mature Technology given the company age
Experienced leadership
High morale
Friendly & smart people
cons: A bit on the younger side

pros: Awesome leadership and solid product give the sales team a huge opportunity for overachievement. If you are willing to work hard and have strong sales skills/acumen - you will love working here.
cons: Outgrowing office, which can lead to a lot of desk shuffling.
advice_to_mgmt: Continue to promote from within and invest in training for both reps and leadership.

pros:
- highly intelligent people
- amazingly fast-growing company with a great long-term vision
- experienced leadership
- constantly asking for and acting on feedback
- Food and perks and dogs!
I feel highly valued at Samsara
cons: None so far. I would say that my desk was dark, but then I asked and someone came and fixed it :)
advice_to_mgmt: As you grow, continue to develop best practices so that everyone can have the amazing experience that I had.

pros: Engineering team is relatively small and close-knit. Great perks. Work moves fast and you're expected to contribute from day one. Everyone is excited and optimistic about the company direction. Plenty of social life among coworkers if you're into that. No pressure to socialize if you're not.
cons: Things are a little cramped due to fast growth, but we're expanding our office space soon!
advice_to_mgmt: Keep taking steps to preserve the community feeling and culture as the company grows!

pros: Growth, Solid solution, great leadership
cons: Tad bit of startup organization errors
advice_to_mgmt: Keep it rolling. You've created an amazing product set and a positive work culture.

pros: free t-shirts, free lunch, fully stocked snacks/beverages
cons: no diversity when it comes to gender/culture/ethnicity/sexual orientation/socio-economic status/age/nationality. 80% of employees seem to be upper middle class white males between ages of 22 and 35

pros:
Genuinely enjoy coming into work every day and love my co-workers!

+talented and kind employees
+very strong product
+leadership that promotes transparency and growth
+positive and energetic environment
cons: Not many. It's a fast-paced environment and easy to stay heads down - as the company grows it can be difficult to know individuals outside your immediate teams.
advice_to_mgmt: Continue the great work!

review_title: Smart People, Great Culture, Fascinating Product
pros:
I love Samsara!
* The company maintains a high talent bar across all teams, especially engineering
* Technology platform is very modern (Go, Typescript, React, GraphQL)
* Kind, caring, funny coworkers - company has great values
* Product is very well positioned to be a major IoT platform
* Feels like the company is firing on all cylinders
* Lots of opportunities for rapid career growth
* Phenomenal executive leadership
cons:
* Since there is so much opportunity for business/product expansion, team can be stretched a bit thin at times.
* Company moves very fast, so priorities can shift quickly at times (but there are also many benefits that come from this)
advice_to_mgmt: Samsara is a truly amazing place to work - make sure to keep it that way! Protect our great culture and continue to guide us on an ambitious and sustainable trajectory.

pros:
Very rarely do you find a leadership team like the one at Samsara. For a tech company in the Bay Area, they are incredibly seasoned and excellent at what they do. They have been working together for over a decade, so they work well together and understand the value of promoting employees from within.

Because of this there is:

Accelerated Career growth
Stability in the sales org - no major reorgs in the history of the company, only the opening of new teams aka promotion opportunities
High appreciation and value of employees
cons:
Samsara is a hyper hyper growth tech company, so it is very fast paced. One should join because this is exciting to them. Do not think that this is a place where you can sit back and not contribute meaningfully. The attitude/culture is that we are all in this together and working to make this company great.

If you're not looking for a fast paced environment, this will not be the best company for you.
advice_to_mgmt: Continue being transparent. It's what makes Samasara unique.

pros:
-Dynamic product with good market fit
-CEO is visionary and approachable
-Catered lunches
-Uber/Lyft credits
-Long term opportunity for growth?
cons:
-Upper management seems to only care about the bottom line. Very much feel like a number who can be replaced. There is a sense that management is more concerned with hiring new employees as opposed to the current players.

-Call centered environment. The expectation is to make from 50-100 cold calls per day (on top of any other tasks you already have). You feel more like a telemarketer as opposed to an AE.

-Heavily micromanaged. There is a watchdog type style of management which is instilled into the sales culture. You are judged by “dials” made almost as much as closed opportunities. Additionally, you are expected to be at your desk (making calls) for the entirety of the day. Management send not so subtle messages when not hitting the number of calls (like being removed from the inbound lead queue).

-Unrealistic expectations for achievement/growth. They underpay for the market with the expectation of over achievement. On the surface it seems very appealing to jump onboard, especially with the achievement numbers that they throw around while recruiting (200% average quota attainment per rep, with high accelerators). With the hyper-growth taking place at Samsara, these numbers are a thing of the past. You will more than likely find yourself making less money and working harder than you would somewhere else.
advice_to_mgmt: Listen to the concerns of your employees and be proactive in addressing them. The CEO is one of a kind and the product could be a game changer in the industry. With that said, it seems like you’re moving too fast and need to clean things up internally.

pros:
Good product market fit

Free lunch + Uber credits

Exciting times at the company
cons:
Treated like kids, hard to take time off on vacation or even away from your desk

High pressure monthly quotas with boring day to day (not many leads coming through), feel like a number

Call center job in dungeon office (other job functions are in nicer brand new office couple blocks away)
advice_to_mgmt: Liven things up, more flexibility and freedom for reps, less hirng and more leads

pros:
- GREAT pay
- The best work like balance, I'm off at three everyday, unlimited PTO and they actually mean it (no guilt trips whatsoever)
- Free lunch four days a week and free breakfast everyday
- Paid uber/lyft credits, and free 24 street parking
- DOG FRIENDLY OFFICE!!
cons: - None that I can think of!
advice_to_mgmt: Keep up the great work!!

review_title: Commercial or SMB still the same
pros:
-Company has great potential
-Our CEO is amazing
-Product is incredible
cons: Commercial was SMB. Doesn't matter what it is called, it sucks. Expect to make 50-100 calls every day and be treated like a child. This is not what they pitched. Every thing you do is controlled and your calls are monitored on screens around the office. Nobody is making money they said we would. Going through the motions until I find something new. Most are.
advice_to_mgmt: Recruiters are having daily conversations with your team, but nobody notices or cares.

pros:
-Fast, growing company
-Senior management really cares about their teams across SMB (commercial), Mid Market, and Enterprise
-Fantastic company perks - love the clubs that Samsara invests money into
-Lots of upside in career growth - a place that grows quickly and promotes frequently
-Have a high bar for caliber of professionals that work here, which helps the company be so successful.
-People are making great money.
cons: -It's a startup, so as you grow fast things can sometimes need some tweaking. The good news is that management is responsive.
advice_to_mgmt: Keep hearing our feedback and making positive moves.

pros:
Amazing team from the executives to the individual contributors.
Platform keeps getting better and better. Always releasing new features.
Executives are transparent and engaging.
cons: Little to no cons. Expect to work hard.
advice_to_mgmt: Keep doing what you are doing.

pros: Fast growing company, culture that promotes over achievement and personal/professional growth. Small team with a lot of potential to grow
cons: There aren't really any cons at this point. It's a new team in a fast paced environment, there's changes everyday but if you're willing to take on the challenge and react quickly then it's a great fit!

pros:
Amazing opportunities for career growth
Scaling quickly, adding new verticals and product
Autonomy in your role
Work / life balance even in startup world
Considerate managers and emphasis on maintaining a positive culture
cons: None- very happy with how everything is going with company

review_title: Best company to work for, even from an outsider's perspective
pros:
Transparent leadership
Treat employees well (fantastic health benefits, Uber/Lyft credit, catered lunch)
Unlimited opportunities
cons: Just stay focused as the company is growing immensely and fast!

review_title: If you can’t grind, we don’t want you.
pros:
-amazing company culture
-great benefits add up
-rewarding work
-superior product
-not expected to work OT unless you want to
-sales is sales. If you don’t want to work hard, don’t bother interviewing.
cons:
-smb and mid market division is very strict
-mid market sales reps are at times condescending to smb sales reps
advice_to_mgmt: Continue the great work!

pros: Company is growing really fast
cons: Senior Management SMB has been the worst. You grind hard for low pay and fake smiles. Working here is crazy af.

pros:
Company is growing really fast, the product is the best in its industry

200$ Uber/Lyft credits each month

Free lunches are good if you like chicken and rice every day.
cons:
Mind-numbingly boring day to day, if you don't like cold calling for hours on end this isn't for you.

Micro-management to the max, reps get sent passive aggressive emails for arriving 5 mins late (even on a 6 or 7 AM start time).

Mid-management is secretive and reps hardly know about changes until after they're in full production (i.e. raising quotas).

Pay isn't competitive at all for SF.
advice_to_mgmt:
practice what you preach, i.e. transparency

Show your employees that you value them. Yes, you're growing fast, but that doesn't mean that employees should be treated like a number and that they're easily replaceable.

review_title: Best company I've ever worked for
pros: Transparent and strong leadership, exciting product, great people and great perks. I love my role and my team.
cons: If anything, it can be stressful because of the start up level of work but we're working hard to hire more talent for this reason.

pros: Incredible leadership team who know how to build companies that last.
cons: High growth means hard work, but well worth it
advice_to_mgmt: Keep it up!

pros:
I have been with Samsara for a while, and can honestly say it is the best company I have ever worked for. I’ve watched us grow from a small scrappy startup to a 300+ person company - the leadership team has always maintained it’s goals of transparency, diversity, inclusion and constant improvement.

My favorite perks are the Lyft rides to work, amazing catered meals, and healthcare benefits.

My favorite thing about working here is the people. The environment is extremely collaborative, there are events and off-sites that bring people together in a very comfortable way. From San Francisco, to San Jose, and now to the UK, this is the place you want to be!
cons: I no longer know everyone's name since we've grown so quickly and dividied teams across multiple offices.

pros:
- Structured on-boarding (mix of learning about the company and just starting to DO week 1)!
- Amazing leadership team
- Ability to take control of your career, quickly!
- Inclusive & friendly office culture - everyone loves what they do and it shows!
cons: - Location (but w/ Uber/Lyft credits it's not bad)
advice_to_mgmt: Keep doing what you're doing!

pros: The first time I visited the office for my onsite interview I immediately picked up on the positive energy and it was a huge reason I chose this company. After two weeks I couldn't be happier with how things are going. The people are really smart, managers are open to feedback and constantly improving processes, and the culture is extremely welcoming. Did I mention burrito day? THEY HAVE A BURRITO DAY - It's bomb. Highly recommend this place.
cons: Honestly can't think of anything.
advice_to_mgmt: Keep it up!

pros:
-Leadership is fantastic. They are so down to earth, transparent, and intelligent
-Huge focus on company culture. Actively working to bring people together from all departments
-Amazing opportunity. People are recognized and promoted accordingly
-Lively work environment. Positive energy and healthy competition
-Great perks. Lyft/Uber credit, free food, swag, boba every other Friday
I cannot say enough! I feel so lucky to be part of such an amazing company.
cons:
-If you aren't comfortable on the phone, might not be the best fit (in regards to sales)
-Be ready to work hard and adapt often - as with most startups. Awesome to see how quickly the company can create change.
advice_to_mgmt: Keep it up! Continue to focus on culture and transparency. The trust you place in your employees is super meaningful. Maintain the culture of overachievement, you can see the positive effect and motivation it has. Cannot wait to see what is next!

review_title: Amazing company that continues to grow and innovate
pros: fun and supportive culture, free lunches, everyone grinds, company is growing like crazy
cons: its a grind and not a good fit for people that want an easy 9-5
advice_to_mgmt: keep doing what you're doing

pros: Amazing place to work, coming to Samsara from corporate America was the best decision i've made in my career!
cons: Long hours but worth it

review_title: Great place for rapid growth with smart and successful team
pros:
- The leadership team has proven that they can lead products to be successful in the market - Meraki, Apple, etc. - you'll get to learn processes and skills that make for a successful company
- People are very smart, and offer good ideas and feedback
- Things move fast here, and you're given responsibility right out of the gate. You won't feel like "the new guy" for long!
cons:
- Company is having some growing pains around mass-communication - I find that I get three different answers to the same question.
- Engineering is very revenue-driven - this is not the place to go if you like to implement a concept from ideation to completion and then send to users.
advice_to_mgmt:
- Build internal systems for documentation - don't rely on mass presentations to get the word out about updated processes or products.
- Carve out more time for proactive engineering projects and products that aren't Frankenstein-y

review_title: Great company for inside sales reps, not for field employees
pros:
Please note that I was a field employee at Samsara that worked out of my home office - not an employee based in their HQ.

Benefits:
-High-growth startup
-Huge potential for quota over achievement for inside sales
-Truly differentiated fleet-management product set with superb engineering team
-Excellent executive leadership
cons:
-Extensive Travel for field employees (3-4 days per week, nearly every week)
-Work/life balance is extremely rough in the field - I had very limited time with my family as compared to my previous employees
-Long sales cycles for enterprise deals, but you are expected to grow your business every single quarter... the field is really feast or famine each quarter with one or two deals ultimately deciding your fate.
-Most events/benefits that others have called out are only relevant for the employees based in the Bay Area offices. Field employees don't get any love
advice_to_mgmt: Have more regular cadences with your field employees about what they are happy with and what they aren't happy with, and then genuinely take the feedback about the stuff they aren't happy with and try to make some changes. Because I joined when Samsara's products were just hitting the market, I felt that my feedback never really mattered and that "it's just this way because we're an early-stage startup."

review_title: Loyalty and trust in an employer
pros: At the start of 2018 I left Apple to work at a startup based in San Francisco called Samsara. I was excited to join a small company of 200 employees after working for one of the largest tech companies in the world. After 3 years with Apple I began to feel like another cog in the machine. Rarely did I see the fruits of my labor. Even after only 3 months at Samsara I know I couldn’t have made a better career switch. Everyday I walk into work I feel like I’m making a difference in the company. Every customer we help, every problem we solve, every sale we close is contributing to the growth of a company I’m personally invested in. Samsara’s management understands that creating a successful employer/employee relationship begins by trusting their employees. Like other startups, Samsara hands out free swag alongside other awesome benefits, but in the end these gestures are more than simply having more Samsara hats and t-shirts then I know what to do with. These practices are indicitive of a company culture that fosters loyalty in it’s employees.
cons: Fast growth makes adjusting and learning difficult. Be sure to ask lots of questions. Finding parking can be difficult at our current office location.
advice_to_mgmt: Continue to nurture the culture of loyalty and trust you've created so far. More commuter options would be nice for those of us crazy enough to commute from San Jose to San Francisco.

pros: Solid leadership. Completely transparent culture. Very skilled workforce. Lots of upward mobility options.
cons: None at the moment.
advice_to_mgmt: Keep it up.

pros:
This company really cares about the people. That sentiment is really clear and is a priority from the very top of the organization down. There is a huge opportunity for professional development. People are recognized for their accomplishments and given raises and promotions accordingly. The company is extremely well organized and transparent. The executive team sits out in the open with everyone and encourages people to approach them and ask questions. There's a mentality towards constant improvement and a feedback loop.

The benefits and culture are really second to none. They really make sure that all your needs coming to work are met so you can really focus on your job. They have a lot of clubs and extracurriculars so you can get connected with people right away. Everyone is really passionate about boba.
cons: The company is growing so there are some normal growing pains like changing offices, desks. I wouldn't really consider that a con. The company definitely encourages a healthy work life balance, but you definitely have to get your work in.
advice_to_mgmt: Keep doing what your doing. The willingness to put people first, to learn and grow, and to be transparent is what is going to keep the company growing and thriving.

pros:
- Huge opportunity, career growth , professional development
- High quota attainment and culture of overachievement, high earning potential
- Leadership: transparent, successful, have a track record of success leading Meraki
- Great new office: good location, large open sales floor in the building, leadership sits on the sales floor and is hands on with the sales team and other departments
- The Product! Strongest technology on the market in our space
- Great work/life balance
- Culture: fast paced, grinding, collaborative, celebrate wins

Perks: Dog Friendly Office, Uber/Lyft Credits, Catered lunch 4 days a week, 401K matching, great health benefits, unlimited vacation policy, gym membership subsidy
cons:
- Be ready to grind
- Located in Potrero Hill *get Uber/Lyft credit to combat this*

Honestly, aren't many cons.
advice_to_mgmt: Keep it up! Continue up the transparency and keep employees in the loop with company goals and plans.

pros:
High degree of transparency
Strong sales culture
Great leadership
Excellent culture
Dog friendly office
Great food and snacks
Healthy competition
cons:
Rapid and frequent changes due to expansion
No other cons that I can think of at this point in time

pros:
-Amazing products that are filling a need in the market.
-Products simply work and customers are able to see immediate value.
-Management is there for you. They plan on how they're going to help you reach your goals and provide you with the necessary materials to do so.
-Companies is filled with hungry, humble, and helpful co-workers. Truly a team atmosphere and it's awesome to be around so many successful, down-to-earth people.
cons:
-Company holidays do not include holidays like Martin Luther King Day and President's day. You can request it off of course as there's unlimited PTO, but extremely surprised those are not company holidays with automatic time off (especially MLK Day).
-Normal growing pains of a startup in hyper-growth. Processes still being established, standards being developed etc.
advice_to_mgmt: Continue to support the ongoing industry knowledge learning for employees.

pros:
Samsara is hands down one of the best decisions I have ever made. It is a great feeling to come in everyday and be surrounded by some of the smartest and most positive people in San Francisco. Samsara has an extremely bright future and I couldn't be more excited to be on this rocketship.

Pros:
-Great team
-Positive culture
-Delicious lunches
-Supportive management
-More than attainable quota
cons: Honestly none that I can think of, one of the best atmospheres I've worked in.
advice_to_mgmt: Keep up the support you provide to everyone.

review_title: Best place I've worked so far
pros: great product, fast-growing, a lot of opportunities to contribute and grow your career, super smart people, everyone is in it together, sky's the limit if you take initiative and are self-directed
cons: long hours but that comes with start-up life in SF
advice_to_mgmt: I love that you guys are transparent with the entire company and celebrate our wins with us - big or small. Everyone respects you because we feel like you really care about us.

review_title: The best company I've ever worked for
pros:
1. Leadership team is unbeatable - very hands on and transparent. The CEO sits on our main floor and is always willing to spend time with his employees.
2. Awesome culture - everyone helps each other out and are very friendly. It's a very collaborative environment where people genuinely care about each others' success.
3. Dog friendly office
4. Great perks - catered lunch, awesome benefits package, uber/lyft credits to get to/from the office
5. THE PRODUCT!!! And we're continuing to expand into different industries so the opportunities here really feel endless
6. Tons of room to grow
cons: They got rid of burrito and sandwich day on Thursdays
advice_to_mgmt: Keep it up!!

pros: Best job I've ever had.
cons: The job is so good I'm almost worried I'm peaking too early in my career.
advice_to_mgmt: Can we get MLK day off?

pros: Great being in an atmosphere with overachievers. I've never been apart of a team where everyone is consistently above quota so this is a great experience. The company is built for success and you can feel the comradery across the organization and you have a great feeling that the company is heading in the right direction and will catapult your career along with it. Lyft/Uber credits also help take some stress out of commuting.
cons: It is more of a pro than a con because this is whats going to allow the company to be successful. Coming into the company it is a lot of information to absorb and the company is constantly adding new products and tweaking processes to make them more efficient. So be ready to soak in a lot of information.

review_title: Rapid Growing Start Up with Amazing Culture
pros: Th sales team is crushing quotas, they have an incredibly smart and transparent leadership team who has "been there before", and an inclusive and fun culture. The energy is exciting to be a part of!
cons: Outbound sales culture if you are afraid of cold calling. Other than that, there's not many negatives.
advice_to_mgmt: Keep doing what you're doing! Continue to make smart hires in the face of rapid growth.

pros:
Cannot say enough good things about this company!
-Amazing product that constantly wow's customers.
-Commission opportunity - most of the team is hitting above quota. It's awesome to have control of your paycheck and definitely attainable to go above and earn more if you want! Work hard play hard mentality.
-Great company culture that values teamwork. Even though sales can be competitive, Samsara manages to balance it very well with a team player mentality.
-Career trajectory is nice. If you are performing well you will be moved up and there are lot's of positions opening as this company is growing so fast.
-Company Growth is huge
-Free lunches
-Uber/Lyft credits
cons:
-No more burrito/ sandwich lunch day
-Location not super convenient but the Lyft and Uber make up for it
advice_to_mgmt: The company is growing so fast which is awesome but remember why a lot of people love it here is for the culture. Even though the company will change over time try to hold onto the culture and value that makes this company so great.

pros:
Fun office

Team having success

Money to be made

Growing like crazy, lot of opportunity
cons: Not really a con but be prepared to grind

pros:
-Great new office
-Everyone greatly exceeds Quota (400+% attainable here)
-New technology that really adds value
-Best on-boarding I've ever had
-Free Uber credits
-Rockstar filled leadership team
cons:
-Truckers/Fleet owners take a bit to get used too
-Recent address change so Uber keeps dropping me off at the wrong place
advice_to_mgmt: -Focus on hiring only the best.

review_title: The Best Career Decision I've Ever Made!
pros:
Coming to Samsara was not easy for me. It required a lot of trust that the machine would continue to perform at 2x-3x+ of quota. The OTE's are a bit lower but match very reasonable quotas. It is intentional to drive reps toward commission and create a culture of over performance.

 A few quarters in and I can say it is as good as the recruiters and job postings say! A few highlights...

-Ability to drive business from cold call to closed won in weeks! (100k+ deals)
-Incredibly fair quota ramp for new reps
-Technology that wow's, has tangible benefits and is incredibly fun to sell
-Visionary leadership from sales, engineering and executives
-Very welcoming culture
cons:
The company is growing insanely fast. That has its downsides.

-After two week on boarding you are almost completely on your own (Managers are there but theres no hand holding)
-Office Location isn't super convenient
-Workforce diversity..The company seems to be attempting to address this
-Worklife balance: No work from home policy at all

**I thought coming in I would feel a bit of an outsider since there are so many people here from Meraki but that hasn't been the case**
advice_to_mgmt: Focus on workforce diversity but keep doing what you are doing. Thank you!

pros: There is so much opportunity in the market, and I have yet to find a vendor that has technology that comes anywhere near what we offer. I've never worked for a company with such great earning potential.
cons: really fast growth, hard to remember people's names.
advice_to_mgmt: grow smart and continue to hire the right people.

pros: Experienced leadership, good coworkers, internal promotions, reasonable hours
cons: Rapid growth comes with pressure and stress
advice_to_mgmt: Keep doing what you're doing

pros:
- Fast paced, ship early and often
- Great culture, very caring and nurturing
cons: Not really a con, but there is a lot of work to do. Don't expect to coast here, we are all here to get something amazing built and out there. That being said there is still plenty of time for fun
advice_to_mgmt: Keep being open and honest with your employees. The true transparency is amazing and world class

review_title: HUGE Opportunity, Fantastic People, Fun Workplace
pros:
-High quota attainment (reps double and triple quota every quarter)

-Talented sales reps (surrounded by sharp individuals that are more than willing to help get new reps ramped)

-Visionary leadership (executive team has been together for 10+ years, great vision for direction of company)

-Lots of potential for career opportunity (team is rapidly growing)

-401k matching, great health benefits, free lunch, Uber/Lyft credit
cons: Neighborhood isn't the greatest but gives us motivation to sell our way outta here!
advice_to_mgmt: Keep doing what you're doing. We love that you sit on the floor next to us and are always approachable/willing to help out on deals!

pros:
1. Leadership Team is second to none
2. Sales team and culture is fun, collaborate & successful
3. Product is strong & presents really well
4. Entire company is resourceful & results driven
5. Industry is exploding
6. Young company, get in while you can
cons: 1. Training is actually really strong & pretty well organized for a start-up, but, some improvements could be made.
advice_to_mgmt:
1. Stay plugged into the ground level with a tight feedback loop
2. Create a "mentor" or buddy program to match new hires with a tenured member of their new team.
3. As you grow very quickly keep hiring ONLY the BEST

pros: Killer product, amazing leadership, active coaching, high-energy sales floor, catered lunches, world class people all around
cons: Haven't come across anything cons yet
advice_to_mgmt: Keep hiring selective and the culture high energy

pros:
Brilliant product; experienced leadership; positive, high-energy, collaborative culture; free lunch; stocked kitchen; laid-back atmosphere.

Best job I've ever had!
cons: The only real con is the location of the office - the neighborhood is full of tent camps and sketchy sidewalks
advice_to_mgmt: Keep doing what you're doing

pros: Genuinely excited team. Great technology. Valuable to the customers. Worth their time to talk to us. Great food and snacks. Free Uber/Lift available.
cons: No gym benefits, hoping that changes soon. Sketchy area, but still convenient.
advice_to_mgmt: Keep the excitement and motivation up. Try getting feedback using anonymous surveys. Set us up with a gym if folks aren's using Uber/Lyft benefits.

pros:
-super smart, supportive co-workers
-very clear this is a team environment, everyone is quick to help
-they are very selective with hiring only the best talent, that also has to be a cultural fit
-great benefits (401k match!), all the snacks you can eat, lunch 4X times a week, happy hours, cool office
-amazing product and customer support
-if you work your a** off and blow it out, you will get paid very well. This is not a place for "average" performers
-very quick and robust training program so you can start selling right away
-tons of opportunity for growth and promotion, we promote from within!
cons:
-no flexibility with OTE packages, need to add a tier for more experienced, enterprise type reps that want to hop on the rocketship but aren't quite a fit for Field just yet
-accelerators could be a little more aggressive
-this isn't really a pro or con but be prepared to grind. Hyper growth startup destined for greatness = hard work.
-a lot of cold-calling, get used to it, but it will get better as we grow our ADR team
-the industry is very slow, old-school, and not entirely technology driven. Know how to speak to the transportation industry and have patience
advice_to_mgmt: Keep doing what you're doing, be transparent and be accessible. I'm very proud to be part of this team.

review_title: best job of my career so far
pros:
- amazing leadership that is sincere, transparent and very experienced (previously Meraki).
- inspiring, hard-working team members who are a pleasure to work with (and hang out with!)
- cool engineering challenges and lots of exposure to work on them.
- good market with lots of potential. company feels like a rocket ship.
- in the heart of San Francisco. ( 201 Potrero Ave. )
- 401k matching (4%), good health / dental / vision, catered food 4 times a week, dinner service for late-night-workers, Uber / Lyft credits for commuters.
cons:
- long hours when projects are coming to a close (but to be expected).
- parking is difficult (offset by Uber / Lyft -- also close to 16th Bart and Caltrain).
advice_to_mgmt: Sanjit, John, Ben, Kiren, Andy -- you guys rock. keep up the amazing work. i'll be here to see this thing take off.

pros:
Great leadership team.
High energy sales floor.
Plenty of resources within the organization to help you succeed.
Great product.
Free Lunches
-401k match
- Great Benefits
cons: No Inside Sales territories. Territories are split by region and leads are disbursed across the team. This makes it tough to build a strong business with a focus on a particular geographic region.

pros: The team is really smart, friendly, motivated, and driven. The work is both meaningful and impactful. There are great Benefits. Samsara is probably the best company I've worked for!
cons: There are several tents around the area that don't make it the nicest neighborhood to walk around, but this is part of a greater city-wide problem that exists in other neighborhoods as well like SOMA.
advice_to_mgmt: Keep doing what you're doing!

pros: Great team of smart and motivated people looking to create real impact in the world. Uber/lyft credits are nice. Really good food.
cons: None than I can think of.

pros: Work with smart people, be challenged, acquire new skills and hit accelerators.
cons: Lots of tents around the Potrero Hill office — it doesn't invite you to explore your surroundings.
advice_to_mgmt: Continue hiring the best of the best — never compromise.

pros:
-Superior leadership
-Incredible coworkers
-Energetic atmosphere
-Awesome perks
-Culture of transparency
cons: None that are significant enough to note here.
advice_to_mgmt: Stay true to your original pitch. Don't raise the bars too high, we're not old enough yet!

pros:
Great leadership
reachable sales targets
great culture
great office with parking
cons: none that i can think of
advice_to_mgmt: Keep it up!

pros:
- Surrounded by incredibly motivated people. Everyone wants the company to succeed and you can see this in their work.
-Benefits: Medical, dental, vision, stocked kitchen, catered lunch 4 days a week.
-Product: Sells itself.
- Big market to sell into.
- Senior management has an open door policy. Come to them with questions.
cons: - Wish there was a dog in the office.
advice_to_mgmt: Really impressed with the company as a whole! Keep rewarding employees for their hard work.

pros: Incredibly smart and motivated people. The product is great and the leadership team is fantastic and credible. Exciting time to join the company and see it grow! Lots of opportunity for promotion and growth.
cons: None that I can think of.

pros:
-Love the culture, team, and expectations
-Everyone is blowing their quota out of the water - fun and stellar product to sell
-Leadership has a proven track record and is incredibly approachable
-Benefits: lyft/uber credit, 401k matching, work/life balance, compensation, catered lunches
cons: None thus far - so far so good!
advice_to_mgmt: Maintain your great relationships with your most powerful force - your employees! The sky is the limit.

pros: Great product developed and sold by a great team. Really good corporate culture, relaxed but very focused when need be. Personally the best job I've ever had.
cons: Haven't experienced any cons yet.

pros:
Earning potential is high, product is nearly flawless; top of its market, engineer and product teams are genius and keep evolving the product to match customer needs.

Perks are great; delicious catered lunch and fully stacked kitchen. Lyft and Uber credits make commute simple. Coworkers are brilliant not only at their current roles, but on their side hustles and life/work experiences.
cons:
Feedback is only from top down, no open forum for other way around.
Would love to see some more women in Mid-Market! (even though the ones we have are AMAZING :) :)
advice_to_mgmt: Agree with previous comment- keep hiring best of the best so that we are driven by our peers.

pros: The people! I feel so lucky to work with such inspiring, intelligent and driven people. Management really cares about transparency, professional development and promoting from within. Perks include meals, in-office yoga classes, Uber/Lyft commuting, and fun group activities.
cons: Keeping up with growth!
advice_to_mgmt: Continuing the transparency and developmental focus on employees with a bigger team will definitely be a challenge, but it's thrilling to see where this start-up began and where it's headed in the coming years. Keep it up!

pros: The leadership is transparent, the product is fantastic, and we get to work with customers of all types on a daily basis. We're solving real world problems (e.g. food safety, CO2 / environmental improvements, energy management and power reductions), and giving our customers insights into industrial operations that they never even imagined was possible.
cons: I'll update this review when I can think of any... Parking outside the office can be tough, but free ubers to work counteract that con.
advice_to_mgmt: Keep up the transparency, vision, and incredible leadership! We're all connected to what we're doing and can't wait to see what's next.

pros: Uber to work, catered lunch, and compensation are all great, but the close-nit team at Samsara is why I work here. I've worked for many organizations large and small, and I've never seen an executive team with the transparency and vision of Samsara.
cons: I can't think of any!
advice_to_mgmt: Keep up the transparency and vision - we all love it. As you scale the business, continue doing everything you can to maintain this awesome energy and culture.

pros:
- overachievement potential
-amazing leadership
- great technology
- fun place to work
cons: None come to mind. Not for the faint of heart.

review_title: On the verge of something great
pros:
Product innovation and customer-first mentality.
Team culture in London. General sense of excitement as we are starting to gain traction.
People. Hiring individuals with clear vision around their progression and goals.
cons: If you know what it means to be part of a hyper-growth start-up - none.

pros:
So many its hard to list them all
- Culture of over achievement, everyone is over exceeding on targets
- Huge earning potential
- Best product on the market, amazing engineering and product team always releasing new features
- Great work/ life balance, everyone leaves on time
- Incredible, experienced leadership team
- Huge growth, with so much opportunity for career growth too
- 2 weeks training in San Francisco in which I met all of the executives in the first week
- Free catered lunches and dinner
- £150 contribution towards your commute
cons: Genuinely can't think of any.
advice_to_mgmt: Keep up the great work.

pros: excellent leadership, huge career promotion opportunity, great pay, innovative product & engineering team, fast growing company,
cons: lot's of pressure to overachieve, can be stressful but that's really any demanding work environment. Expectations are extremely high, but so is the valuation of the business.

review_title: Amazing leadership team and sales culture that always over achieves
pros:
- Great culture where everyone is driving towards the same goals
- Fantastic commission structure which gives high earning potential
- A flawless management team in London who are very supportive and approachable
- The lunches and travel benefits!
cons: - Would be nice to have more organised nights out or team activities
advice_to_mgmt: Keep taking feedback from various teams, it's a great approach to help grow the EMEA office. I do think we should spend some time celebrating wins more often but other than that you're doing an amazing job :)

review_title: Exciting times! Outstanding company and culture.
pros:
Amazing time to be part of an amazing company!
Highly transparent.
Great leadership
the best product set , far better than anything in the market and developing quickly.
Opportunity to grow and develop. Learn from great people and accelerate your career.
Sales team vastly exceeded their quotas right now.
Fantastic team spirit in London.

+++ the list goes on
cons: None I can think of right now. The 'negatives' of being a startup are outweighed but the ability to be nimble and fast paced.

pros: Incredible overachievement, hyper-growth that supports upward mobility in career, work hard /play hard, best leadership team in Silicon Valley, top sales talent.
cons: Nothing comes to mind :)

review_title: Great team and a once in a lifetime opportunity to grow
pros:
Best team I've ever worked with. Talented, good vision, great integrity. They are building a company for the long haul.

The opportunity in London is super exciting. I get to solve new problems every day and make a real difference in the business. The team is close-knit and fun.
cons: We all feel a real responsibility to deliver. You never get to go through the motions - but for me that is great.
advice_to_mgmt: Keep it up.

pros:
-fun, fast paced, high energy sales floor
- free lunches
- great leadership
- awesome sales culture: always pushes you to be better
- stock in an appreciating company
cons: I cannot think of any.
advice_to_mgmt: Keep doing what you are doing. Continue to innovate the product and deliver high class products to customers!
